page.title: 12CROFTING IN PLOCKTON.
page.content: THERE ARE NO LARGE FARMS HERE,BUT {AGRICULTURE}IS CARRIED ON BY{CROFTING. CROFTS HERE ARE SMALL,WITH MAYBE ONLY ONE OR TWO ACRES ON WHICH TO GROW OATS POTATOES,TURNIPS OR HAY.EACH CROFTER ALSO HAS A SHARE OF THE{COMMON GRAZING WHICH IS ROUGH HILL GROUND USED FOR CATTLE OR{SHEEP.}MOST CROFTERS ARE ONLY PART TIME AND HAVE ANOTHER JOB AS WELL.THE DUIRINISH CROFTERS KEEP SHEEP,BUT IN PLOCKTON AND DRUMBUIE THEY ONLY KEEP CATTLE.COWS WANDER FREELY ON THE COMMON GRAZING,AND IN HOT WEATHER IN SUMMER OFTEN BATHE IN THE SEA OR LIE ON THE SHORE.IN{SPRING THE FIELDS ARE PLOUGHED AND PLANTED. DURING THE{SUMMER}GATHERING IN THE HAY NEEDS LOTS OF HELPERS.IN THE{AUTUMN THE CROPS ARE HARVESTED,AND THAT YEARS {LAMBS AND CALVES}ARE SENT TO MARKET.IN {WINTER}THE CATTLE ARE FED WELL,AS THEY STAY OUT AND WILL CALF IN THE SPRING.
